commands.name: Audit npm Dependencies
commands.description: Runs a security audit on npm dependencies to identify known vulnerabilities. This command checks your package.json against the npm security database and reports any security issues found in your dependencies.

commands.name: Fix npm Vulnerabilities
commands.description: Automatically fixes security vulnerabilities in npm dependencies where possible. This updates packages to secure versions and can resolve many common security issues automatically.

commands.name: Audit yarn Dependencies
commands.description: Runs a security audit on yarn dependencies to identify known vulnerabilities. This checks your package.json against the yarn security database and reports security issues.

commands.name: Fix yarn Vulnerabilities
commands.description: Automatically fixes security vulnerabilities in yarn dependencies where possible. This updates packages to secure versions and resolves common security issues.

commands.name: Audit pnpm Dependencies
commands.description: Runs a security audit on pnpm dependencies to identify known vulnerabilities. This checks your package.json against the pnpm security database and reports security issues.

commands.name: Fix pnpm Vulnerabilities
commands.description: Automatically fixes security vulnerabilities in pnpm dependencies where possible. This updates packages to secure versions and resolves common security issues.

commands.name: Test with Snyk
commands.description: Runs Snyk security testing on your project. Snyk is a security platform that helps find and fix vulnerabilities in dependencies, containers, and infrastructure as code.

commands.name: Monitor with Snyk
commands.description: Monitors your project with Snyk for ongoing security vulnerabilities. This creates a snapshot of your dependencies and continuously monitors for new security issues.

commands.name: Test Docker Container
commands.description: Tests a Docker container for security vulnerabilities using Snyk. This scans the container image for known vulnerabilities in the base image and installed packages.

commands.name: Check Python Dependencies
commands.description: Checks Python dependencies for known security vulnerabilities using Safety. Safety is a security tool that checks your installed packages against a database of known vulnerabilities.

commands.name: Scan Python Code
commands.description: Scans Python code for common security issues using Bandit. Bandit is a security linter that finds common security issues in Python code, such as hardcoded passwords and SQL injection.

commands.name: Scan with Semgrep
commands.description: Scans code for security issues using Semgrep. Semgrep is a static analysis tool that finds bugs and security issues in your code using pattern matching and semantic analysis.

commands.name: Scan for Secrets
commands.description: Scans for secrets and sensitive information in your codebase using Gitleaks. This tool detects hardcoded passwords, API keys, tokens, and other sensitive data that shouldn't be in version control.

commands.name: Scan with TruffleHog
commands.description: Scans for secrets and sensitive information using TruffleHog. This tool searches through git history and current code for accidentally committed secrets like API keys and passwords.

commands.name: Scan with Nuclei
commands.description: Scans web applications for vulnerabilities using Nuclei. Nuclei is a fast vulnerability scanner that uses templates to detect security issues in web applications and infrastructure.

commands.name: Run OWASP ZAP Baseline
commands.description: Runs OWASP ZAP baseline scan on a web application. ZAP (Zed Attack Proxy) is a web application security scanner that helps find vulnerabilities in web applications.

commands.name: Network Port Scan
commands.description: Scans network ports and services using Nmap. Nmap is a network discovery and security auditing tool that can identify open ports, services, and potential vulnerabilities.

commands.name: Vulnerability Scan
commands.description: Runs a vulnerability scan using Nmap scripts. This uses Nmap's built-in vulnerability detection scripts to identify common security issues on target systems.

commands.name: SSL/TLS Security Scan
commands.description: Scans SSL/TLS configuration for security issues using SSLyze. This tool checks for weak ciphers, outdated protocols, and other SSL/TLS security problems.

commands.name: Test SSL Configuration
commands.description: Tests SSL/TLS configuration using testssl.sh. This comprehensive tool checks for various SSL/TLS security issues including certificate problems, weak ciphers, and protocol support.

commands.name: Directory Brute Force
commands.description: Scans for hidden directories and files using Dirb. This tool performs directory brute forcing to discover hidden web content that might reveal sensitive information.

commands.name: Scan with Gobuster
commands.description: Scans for directories and files using Gobuster. Gobuster is a fast directory/file enumeration tool that can discover hidden web content and potential security issues.

commands.name: Web Server Scan
commands.description: Scans web servers for vulnerabilities using Nikto. Nikto is a web server scanner that checks for dangerous files, outdated software, and other security issues.

commands.name: SQL Injection Test
commands.description: Tests for SQL injection vulnerabilities using SQLMap. SQLMap is an automated SQL injection and database takeover tool that can detect and exploit SQL injection vulnerabilities.

commands.name: Password Brute Force
commands.description: Performs password brute force attacks using Hydra. Hydra is a parallelized login cracker that supports numerous protocols and can test multiple passwords against various services.

commands.name: Password Cracking
commands.description: Cracks password hashes using John the Ripper. John is a fast password cracker that can crack various types of password hashes using dictionary attacks and brute force methods.

commands.name: GPU Password Cracking
commands.description: Cracks password hashes using Hashcat with GPU acceleration. Hashcat is a fast password recovery tool that can utilize GPU power for faster password cracking.

commands.name: Search Metasploit Modules
commands.description: Searches for Metasploit modules. Metasploit is a penetration testing framework that provides exploits, payloads, and auxiliary modules for security testing.

commands.name: Capture Network Traffic
commands.description: Captures and analyzes network traffic using Wireshark. Wireshark is a network protocol analyzer that can capture and display network packets for security analysis.

commands.name: Command Line Packet Capture
commands.description: Captures network packets using tcpdump. tcpdump is a command-line packet analyzer that can capture and save network traffic for later analysis.

commands.name: Test SSL Connection
commands.description: Tests SSL/TLS connection using OpenSSL. This command connects to a server and displays detailed information about the SSL/TLS handshake and certificate.

commands.name: Check Certificate Expiry
commands.description: Examines SSL certificate details using OpenSSL. This command displays comprehensive information about an SSL certificate including validity dates, issuer, and subject.

commands.name: Check Firewall Status
commands.description: Checks the status of UFW (Uncomplicated Firewall). UFW is a user-friendly interface for managing iptables firewall rules on Ubuntu and other Linux distributions.

commands.name: Check Fail2Ban Status
commands.description: Checks the status of Fail2Ban. Fail2Ban is an intrusion prevention software that protects servers from brute force attacks by monitoring log files and blocking suspicious IP addresses.
